required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Outcome of Covid-19 Surgical Patients: Case-series of a High-risk Area Community Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Short-term Outcome of Covid-19 Surgical Patients: Case-series of a High-risk Area Community Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale di Lodi

clinical_study.source: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale di Lodi

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators retrospectively evaluated all the patients operated in a high-risk community hospital from the first Italian case of Covid-19 (February 21st) to the April 10th (in order to have at least a 30-days follow-up). The investigators selected those patients who had a preoperative or post-operative positive Real Time - Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) for SARS-CoV-2 and the clinical outcome of the participants was evaluated in term of need of Intensive Care Unit (ICU) post-operative recovery, medical and surgical complications, length of hospital stay and death.

intervention.intervention_name: Surgical procedures performed under general anesthesia
intervention.description: Surgical procedures performed under general anesthesia in patients with perioperative SARS-CoV-2 infection

study_pop.textblock: General population referring to a community hospital during the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak in the Northern Italy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- preoperative or post-operative positive Real Time - Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) for SARS-CoV-2
- surgical procedure in elective or acute care surgery performed under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients operated without general anesthesia
- patients preoperatively intubated for Covid-19

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale di Lodi
